question: What happened to Cedar Cloud during the outage from June 16 to July 1, 2025?
answer: Cedar Cloud remained operational, though brief interruptions occurred during the maintenance window. A system reset was required for full recovery after an unexpected cooling tower failure.

question: Why was login node access unavailable during the Cedar outage from June 16 to July 1, 2025?
answer: Login node access was unavailable for the entire outage period due to vendor data synchronization work.

question: How were file systems accessible during the Cedar outage from June 16 to July 1, 2025?
answer: File systems were accessible read-only via Globus only throughout the outage. Read-only access was provided to all file systems during the week of June 16, and limited to the old project file system (`/project/<project name>` via Globus) during the week of June 23.

question: What was the status of job submissions during the Cedar outage from June 16 to July 1, 2025?
answer: Job submissions were suspended during the outage; previously submitted jobs ran once the outage concluded.

question: What was the duration of the second scheduled electrical maintenance for Béluga, Narval, and Juno (non-HA) in June 2025?
answer: The outage for Béluga and Narval compute nodes, and Juno Cloud (non-High Availability zone) instances, lasted from June 13, 2025, at 12:00 p.m. (noon EDT) until June 16, 2025, at 12:00 p.m. (noon EDT).

question: Were Béluga cloud instances or Juno Cloud High Availability zone instances affected by the June 13-16, 2025, outage?
answer: No, these interruptions did not affect Béluga cloud instances or Juno cloud instances in the High Availability zone.

question: During the June 13-16, 2025, outage, was Béluga and Narval storage accessible?
answer: Yes, Béluga and Narval storage remained accessible via Globus and the login nodes of each cluster.

question: When was the scheduled electrical maintenance for Béluga, Narval, and Juno (non-HA) that occurred from June 6, 2025?
answer: It was from June 6, 2025, 9:00 a.m. (EDT) until June 10, 2025, 12:00 p.m. (noon EDT).

question: What services experienced brief interruptions during the June 6-10, 2025, electrical maintenance?
answer: Cloud instances on Béluga Cloud and in the Juno Cloud HA zone experienced short access outages. Storage systems on Béluga and Narval also saw intermittent disruptions.

question: What was the impact on compute nodes for Béluga and Narval during the April 30 - May 1, 2025, outage?
answer: Béluga and Narval compute nodes were shut down from 12:00 PM (EDT) on April 30 until 12:00 PM (EDT) on May 1, 2025.

question: Which Juno Cloud instances were affected by the April 30 - May 1, 2025, electrical maintenance?
answer: Cloud instances in the Juno cloud (non-high availability zone) were shut down during this time. Juno cloud instances in the high availability zone were not affected.

question: What was the purpose of the Cedar cluster outage from March 31 to April 2, 2025?
answer: A planned outage was required to perform power modifications as part of the preparations for bringing new equipment online.

question: Could users log in or run jobs on the Cedar cluster during the March 31 - April 2, 2025, outage?
answer: No, the Cedar cluster was completely unavailable, so users were not able to log in or run jobs. Any running jobs were terminated.

question: Did Cedar Cloud remain operational during the March 31 - April 2, 2025, Cedar cluster outage?
answer: Yes, Cedar Cloud remained operational during this period.

question: What was the original and extended duration of the Graham cluster outage?
answer: The outage was originally scheduled from December 7, 2024, to January 3, 2025, but was extended to February 24, 2025, due to delays.

question: Which services were unavailable during the Graham cluster outage from December 2024 to February 2025?
answer: All Graham cluster services, storage, and cloud services were entirely unavailable during this time.

question: Why were Béluga and Narval compute nodes temporarily reduced from January 13 to February 14, 2025?
answer: The reduction was required for performance and stability tests on Rorqual.

question: What was the status of Béluga compute nodes during the temporary reduction period from January 13 to January 31, 2025?
answer: All Béluga compute nodes were shut down during this period.

question: How much of Narval's compute capacity was affected during the January 13 to January 31, 2025, reduction?
answer: Approximately half of Narval compute nodes, including about 50% of nodes from each category (CPU, GPU, and large memory), were shut down.

question: Were Béluga and Juno cloud instances affected by the temporary reduction from January 13 to February 14, 2025?
answer: No, Béluga and Juno cloud instances were unaffected.

question: What was the update regarding Narval's compute capacity in late January 2025?
answer: As of January 30, 2025, Narval's compute capacity was at 100% until February 6, then again at 30% for the last Rorqual tests. Full capacity for Béluga and Narval was expected by February 14.

question: When were Niagara and Mist compute nodes shut down for system improvements?
answer: Niagara and Mist compute nodes were shut down on January 22, 2025, from 8 AM to 5 PM EST.

question: What services remained available during the January 22, 2025, outage for Niagara and Mist?
answer: The login nodes, file systems, and the HPSS system remained available.

question: What action was recommended for users regarding their data on the Cedar /scratch filesystem before the January 13-21, 2025, outage?
answer: Users were asked to move any important data immediately to their /project, /nearline, or /home directory as the /scratch filesystem was being migrated.

question: Did Cedar cloud remain operational during the January 13-21, 2025, Cedar compute cluster shutdown?
answer: Yes, Cedar cloud remained operational during this period.

question: What was the reason for the Niagara outage on November 25-26, 2024?
answer: A full power shutdown was planned for main panel upgrades ahead of the Trillium cluster setup.

question: What was the advice for users with jobs on Niagara before the November 25-26, 2024, outage?
answer: Users were encouraged to submit smaller, short-duration jobs to optimize idle node usage before the maintenance begins.

question: Which systems at the SciNet Datacenter were unavailable on November 7-8, 2024?
answer: All systems and storage at the SciNet Datacenter, including Niagara, Mist, HPSS, Rouge, Teach, JupyterHub, and Balam, were unavailable.

question: Why was the SciNet Datacenter outage necessary on November 7-8, 2024?
answer: This outage was necessary for installing new electrical equipment (UPS) as part of a systems refresh.

question: What was the status of Cedar login nodes, storage, and cloud services during the November 7-8, 2024, Cedar outage?
answer: Cedar login nodes, storage, and cloud services remained operational and unaffected, while Cedar compute nodes were unavailable.
